conclusion: To determine whether the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark, we need to calculate the displacement of the particle over the given time interval using the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
The displacement is given by the area under the velocity-time graph.

The v-t graph shows three segments: (1) from t = 0 to t = 1 second with constant velocity at 2 m/s, (2) from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds with velocity decreasing linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s, and (3) from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds with velocity decreasing linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.

premise: The velocity is constant at 2 m/s from t = 0 to t = 1 second.
conclusion: The area under the graph for this segment is a rectangle with height 2 m/s and width 1 s.

premise: The area under the graph for this segment is a rectangle with height 2 m/s and width 1 s.
conclusion: Area = height × width = 2 m/s × 1 s = 2 m.

premise: The velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds.
conclusion: The area under the graph for this segment is a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s.

premise: The area under the graph for this segment is a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s.
conclusion: Area = 0.5 × base × height = 0.5 × 1 s × 2 m/s = 1 m.

premise: The velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds.
conclusion: The area under the graph for this segment is a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s (considering the magnitude).

premise: The area under the graph for this segment is a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s (considering the magnitude).
conclusion: Since the velocity is negative, the area will be negative, indicating movement in the opposite direction.

premise: Since the velocity is negative, the area will be negative, indicating movement in the opposite direction.
conclusion: Area = -0.5 × base × height = -0.5 × 1 s × 2 m/s = -1 m.

premise: Displacement from t = 0 to t = 1 second = 2 m, displacement from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds = 1 m, displacement from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds = -1 m.
conclusion: Total displacement = 2 m + 1 m - 1 m = 2 m.
